title: Jupyter Misconfiguration Exposes Systems to Root Privilege Escalation

content.raw: Security researchers have uncovered a vulnerability in commonly misconfigured Jupyter notebook servers that allows attackers to gain root-level access on Linux systems. The flaw doesn’t stem from a bug in Jupyter itself, but rather from dangerous configuration choices that leave systems wide open to privilege escalation attacks.
